meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of wool.
meanings.sent1: The sheep had a woolier coat than the others in the flock.
meanings.sent2: Her sweater felt woolier than his cotton shirt.
meanings.sent3: The woolier blanket made the baby giggle as she snuggled in it.
meanings.sent4: The fog was so thick it seemed to be made of a woolier substance.
meanings.sent5: The woolier fabric kept her warm on the chilly evening.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of wool.
meanings.sent1: The woolier socks were softer and warmer than the cotton ones.
meanings.sent2: His voice had a woolier tone after he woke up from a nap.
meanings.sent3: The woolier gloves made it hard for him to use his phone.
meanings.sent4: The woolier texture of the bread made it taste more comforting.
meanings.sent5: The woolier carpet felt cozy under their feet in the winter.

meanings.definition: Resembling wool in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The clouds looked woolier than usual today.
meanings.sent2: The woolier clouds signaled a change in the weather.
meanings.sent3: The woolier scarf matched perfectly with her winter coat.
meanings.sent4: The woolier paint gave the walls a warm and inviting feel.
meanings.sent5: The woolier flowers in the garden added a touch of softness to the landscape.
